(constant) COLLECTION_KEY :string

The key used in local storage to store and retrieve the cards in the collection.

Methods

formatMarketPrice(fullCard) → {string}

Given a Poké TCG API card object, computes and formats the market‐price range across all available pricing variants, or returns a fallback if none exist.
Parameters:
Name Type Description
fullCard Object The full card data as returned by the Poké TCG API.
Properties
Name Type Attributes Description
tcgplayer Object <optional>
 Optional TCGPlayer block containing pricing information.
Properties
Name Type Attributes Description
prices Object.<string, {market:number}> <optional>
 An object whose keys are variant names (e.g. "normal", "reverseHolofoil") and whose values contain a `market` number.
Source:
  • assets/scripts/priceHelper.js, line 18
Returns:
A formatted price string: - `"$X.XX"` if all variants share the same market price, - `"$X.XX – $Y.YY"` if there’s a range, - `"Price unavailable"` if no data is present.
Type
string

handleAddCard(imgURL)

Handles the action after a card has been added to the collection. This re-renders the binder view with the updated card data.
Parameters:
Name Type Description
imgURL string The image URL of the card that was added. (Not currently used.)
Source:
  • assets/scripts/binder-controller.js, line 70

initializeFilters() → {void}

Initializes the Pokémon filter panel. - Waits for essential DOM elements to load. - Adds a styled filter dropdown with sort options. - Dispatches a 'sortCards' custom event with the selected sorting method. This function should be called once after the DOM is fully loaded.
Source:
  • assets/scripts/pokemon-filter.js, line 13
Returns:
Type
void

showAddCardModal(context)

Displays a modal popup to search for and add a Pokémon card to the collection or binder. The modal allows searching via the Pokémon TCG API, selecting a card, and confirming the addition. This function sets up: - A search input for name and number - Dynamic card result rendering - Selection handling and confirmation - Saving to localStorage - Updating UI via `handleAddCard`
Parameters:
Name Type Description
context 'binder' | 'collection' Determines if the card is added to the binder or just the collection.
Source:
  • assets/scripts/addCardModal.js, line 19

showAssignCardModal(pageIndex, slotIndex)

Displays a modal popup listing existing cards from localStorage for assignment to a binder slot. Allows the user to pick a card from the collection and assign it to a specific page and slot in the binder. Updates localStorage and re-renders the binder.
Parameters:
Name Type Description
pageIndex number The index of the binder page to assign the card to.
slotIndex number The index of the slot on the page where the card should go.
Source:
  • assets/scripts/assign-card-modal.js, line 11

showBinder() → {void}

Shows the binder view and hides the collection view. Adjusts navigation and control elements to suit the binder layout.
Source:
  • assets/scripts/collection-controller.js, line 32

showCollection() → {void}

Shows the collection view and hides the binder view. Modifies control bar classes and visibility of navigation buttons accordingly.

showOfflineAddCardModal(context) → {void}

Displays a modal popup listing offline card subset to add to collection or binder. - Allows user to choose from pre-defined offline cards. - Supports selection, preview, and confirmation to add. - Persists selection to localStorage and updates collection/binder views.
Parameters:
Name Type Description
context 'binder' | 'collection' Determines whether the selected card is added to the binder or the collection.
Source:
  • assets/scripts/offline-add-card-modal.js, line 15
Returns:
Type
void

turnPageLeft()

Instructs the component to flip backward by two pages. Typically used for navigating to the previous set of card pages.
Source:
  • assets/scripts/binder-controller.js, line 45

turnPageRight()

Instructs the component to flip forward by two pages. Typically used for navigating to the next set of card pages.
Source:
  • assets/scripts/binder-controller.js, line 34

updateBinder()

Reads the flat collection array from localStorage (key: "pokemonCollection"), parses it, and hands it to to re-render. If the stored data is not a valid array or fails to parse, it defaults to an empty array.
Source:
  • assets/scripts/binder-controller.js, line 12
